climbs.name: Walden's Room
climbs.fa: Cameron Burns, Brian Takei  22 Oct. 1994  FFA- Jon Butler , Cameron Burns  Oct. 1995

content.description:
The route starts near the left side of the East face of the formation.

P1- Climb a handcrack to a ledge.

P2- Climb a corner and an offwidth to ledges.

P3- Move the belay up and right to below a drilled angle.  Climb up the finger crack and continue past drilled angles to the summit.  5.10+
content.protection: Two sets of cams to a #3 camalot, Stoppers, A bigger piece or two.

content.description: This is the small tower on the South side of the House of Putterman formation.  It can be aided and top roped or freed at mid 5.12 with thin and delicate moves.  Like I always say: "It may be short, but it sure is thin!"
content.protection: Clip four bolts to a two bolt anchor.

climbs.name: Neurological Stimulation
climbs.fa: Bria Shelton, Ryan Sayers, Mark Tjaden

content.description: Neurological Stimulation is a traverse pitch to reach the base of Digital Stimulation. The rock is pretty bad but the climbing is easy. Start from the saddle on the right side of the House of putterman formation-north face. Walk and climb the ledge to the left towards the center of the formation, the climbing will start about 20 feet onto the ledge and continue to the end in a small cave. This route was only used to get to the other climbs; it is not really worth doing by itself.
content.protection: Finger size cams, nuts 1 set and a couple yellow aliens.

content.description: This fun pitch starts about 30 ft right of Walden's room in beautiful L facing corner. Long reach get's you to first pocket in dihedral. Lieback up dihedral until you can reach the  jams. Enter squeeze chimney (fun grunting) and ascend until it is possible to exit right under roof. A few more lieback moves takes you to good anchor visible from ground.
content.protection: We TR'd this pitch after finishing walden's room. Look's like it would be difficult to pro at the start (bring small-med. nuts).

climbs.name: Digital Stimulation
climbs.fa: Ryan Sayers, Brian Shelton, Mark Tjaden

content.description: Digital Stimulation is a beautiful left facing Dihedral in quality rock on the North face of House of Putterman. It is to the right side of center on the formation. Climb either Digital Direct or Neurological Stimulation to get on the ledge to begin the route. (The dirty stuff before hand is worth it believe me.)Belay in the small cave below the climb. Climb out a small roof into the crack and lay-back to the anchors.
content.protection: Bring 4-#.75 and 2-#2's for the meat for the climb and a few small pieces for the start/botton anchor. A three bolt anchor is at the top.

content.description: This route is not the best line but it gets you above the bad rock to the ledge for the pump-fest of Digital Stimulation that's not to be missed. On the North face you can't help but notice a perfect left facing dihedral that starts on a ledge 40 feet up. Digital Direct starts 40 feet left in a broken corner.
content.protection: Bring a couple hand sized cams 2 #2's for an anchor and some large nuts.
